ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were scaring the monks from the group of seventeen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.6_0: “These monks from the group of six are scaring us.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.8_0: “How can the monks from the group of six scare other monks?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.12_0: “... Foolish men, how can you scare other monks?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:1.15.1_0: ‘If a monk scares a monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.8_0: If one who is fully ordained, wishing to scare another who is fully ordained, arranges a sight, a sound, a smell, a taste, or a physical contact,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.8_1: then whether the other person is scared or not, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.9_0: if she tells him about a wilderness inhabited by criminals, inhabited by predatory animals, or inhabited by demons,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.1.9_1: then whether the other person is scared or not, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.1_0: If the other person is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he scares him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.2_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he scares him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.3_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he scares him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.4_0: If, wishing to scare someone who is not fully ordained, he arranges a sight, a sound, a smell, a taste, or a physical contact,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.5_0: then whether the other person is scared or not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.6_0: if she tells him about a wilderness inhabited by criminals, inhabited by predatory animals, or inhabited by demons,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.7_0: then whether the other person is scared or not, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.8_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.9_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.2.10_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.2_0: if he arranges a sight, a sound, a smell, a taste, or a physical contact, or he tells about a wilderness inhabited by criminals, inhabited by predatory animals, or inhabited by demons, but not because he wishes to scare anyone;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.4_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc55:2.3.5_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on scaring, is finished.
